content: At this revenue base, which we think is well within our reach in the short term, we believe we will be able to fund product CapEx for our existing customers and reduced cash burn before interest expense to approximately $30 million. One, we had higher revenue per shipment versus last year, due to both the price increase and high add-on activity; two, rental product depreciation was 18% of revenue versus 24% in Q2 '21 as it was absorbed over a higher revenue base. We are very pleased with our adjusted EBITDA this quarter, which was positive for the first time since we went public, coming in at $1.8 million versus negative $1.9 million in Q2 last year, representing a positive 2.4% margin and a 6-point improvement versus negative 4.1% last year. In terms of full year, we now expect revenue in the range of $285 million to $290 million, representing 40% to 43% growth versus full year '21. Please proceed with your question. Please proceed with your question. Please proceed with your question. Please proceed with your question. Please proceed with your question. You mentioned - I think you said it was up 5% in the quarter on a year-over-year basis, driven by price increases and higher add-on given the decline in active subs, could you maybe break down the contribution by each of the components and the 5% increase just to - I'm curious which of the inputs you see as most sustainer inputs that were more affected by some of the macro cross-currency pointed to in the quarter. Please proceed with your question. Please proceed with your question. Please proceed with your question. Please proceed with your question.
